metadata.title: Convert PSI to Kilopascals – Pressure Converter
metadata.description: Convert pressure from PSI (Pounds per Square Inch) to Kilopascals (kPa), useful for metric pressure specification.

introduction: This converter transforms pressure measurements from PSI to Kilopascals, enabling metric pressure interpretation.
PSI is standard in North America while kilopascals are used internationally. Understanding both is essential for equipment compatibility.
This converter uses the standard relationship where 1 PSI equals approximately 6.89476 kilopascals.
methodology: 1 PSI ≈ 6.89476 kPa. To convert PSI to kPa, multiply by 6.89476. For example, 20 PSI ≈ 138 kPa, 35 PSI ≈ 241 kPa.
Equipment from different regions may use different pressure units, requiring conversion for proper setup.
Safety systems depend on correct pressure specifications. Understanding conversion is critical.
This converter provides precise pressure conversions for equipment maintenance.
examples: Example 1 – Tire pressure: 32 PSI equals approximately 220 kPa.
Example 2 – Air compressor: A 100 PSI rating equals approximately 690 kPa.
Example 3 – Hydraulic system: 5,000 PSI equals approximately 34,474 kPa.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from PSI to Kilopascals?
faqs.answer: 1 PSI ≈ 6.89476 kPa. Multiply PSI by 6.89476 to get kPa.

faqs.question: What is typical tire pressure in both units?
faqs.answer: Passenger car: 32-35 PSI ≈ 220-240 kPa. Truck: 35-40 PSI ≈ 240-275 kPa.

faqs.question: How do I convert standard atmosphere to kPa?

glossary.definition: Pounds per Square Inch, imperial unit of pressure.
Metric pressure unit equal to 1,000 pascals.
